timeline.message:
[561361] ES2IS and Interface generation consistency

Change-Id: I252488ebbb3bd1bdc3e9bbf124e55b32900eba15
Signed-off-by: Philippe DUL <philippe.dul@thalesgroup.com>

[561361] ES2IS and Interface generation consistency

Change-Id: I252488ebbb3bd1bdc3e9bbf124e55b32900eba15
Signed-off-by: Philippe DUL <philippe.dul@thalesgroup.com>

timeline.bodyText:
It was not consistent with Interface generation from FunctionalExchange.
Provider shall be the target of the Exchange. Requirer, the source
timeline.author: pdulth

timeline.bodyText:
Previously, we were inverting sequence message conveying EVENT exchange items.
But this was not consistent as it is not possible to recrete manually such inverted messages with palette tools.
By removing inversion, its now consistent with tool palettes and generated interfaces
timeline.author: pdulth
timeline.diffHunk:
@@ -149,15 +148,6 @@ public static boolean mustInverse(AbstractEnd end, int i) {
   }

timeline.bodyText: If the sequenceMessage will not have an operation, then we don't create it.
timeline.author: pdulth
timeline.diffHunk:
@@ -45,27 +44,51 @@
   protected boolean transformIsRequired(EObject element_p, ITransfo transfo_p) {

timeline.bodyText: Instead of creating the Interface based from Functional Exchange while the projection, we do it before. (see below Rule_Scenario, "beforeTransformation")
timeline.author: pdulth
